Authors: Jia Yu , Xue-Wei Wang, Li-Wei Zhou
Title:
Taxonomy and phylogeny of Resinicium sensu lato revealing a
new genus and five new species in Hymenochaetales (Basidiomycota) from
Asia Pacific
Keywords:
corticioid fungi, Skvortzovia, Skvortzoviella,
wood-inhabiting fungi, six new taxa
Abstract:
Hymenochaetales, belonging to Agaricomycetes,
Basidiomycota, is a not well-framed fungal order at the family level
from the phylogenetic perspective, due mainly to the not comprehensively
recognized species diversity of some genera without certain taxonomic
positions at the family level. To improve the knowledge of species
diversity within Hymenochaetales, two dozen of Asia Pacific specimens
preliminarily identified to be members of Resinicium s.l. are carefully
studied from morphological and phylogenetic perspectives. From these
specimens, a new monotypic genus Skvortzoviella, and five new species,
viz.Â Resinicium austroasianum, R. magnihalocystidium, Skvortzovia
dabieshanensis, S. qilianensis and Skvortzoviella lenis are described.
Although the family positions of Resinicium, Skvortzovia and
Skvortzoviella are still ambiguous, the current study provides new
materials for further reconstructing the phylogenetic frame of
Hymenochaetales. In addition, the ancestral geographic origin of
Resinicium was estimated in Asia Pacific instead of previously assumed
tropical America.
